04009                        mdt_obd_name(m), next);
04010                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
04011         }
04012 
04013         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
04014         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
04015 
04016         rc = obd_connect(NULL, exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data, NULL);
04017         if (rc) {
04018                 CERROR("%s: cannot connect to next dev %s (%d)\n",
04019                        mdt_obd_name(m), next, rc);
04020                 GOTO(out, rc);
04021         }
04022 
04023 out:
04024         if (data)
04025                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
04026         RETURN(rc);
04027 }
04028 
04029 static int mdt_stack_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *mdt,
04030                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
04031 {
04032         char                   *dev = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
04033         int                     rc, name_size, uuid_size;
04034         char                   *name, *uuid, *p;
04035         struct lustre_cfg_bufs *bufs;
04036         struct lustre_cfg      *lcfg;
04037         struct obd_device      *obd;
04038         struct lustre_profile  *lprof;
04039         struct lu_site         *site;
04040         ENTRY;
04041 
04042         /* in 1.8 we had the only device in the stack - MDS.
04043          * 2.0 introduces MDT, MDD, OSD; MDT starts others internally.
04044          * in 2.3 OSD is instantiated by obd_mount.c, so we need
04045          * to generate names and setup MDT, MDD. MDT will be using
04046          * generated name to connect to MDD. for MDD the next device
04047          * will be LOD with name taken from so called "profile" which
04048          * is generated by mount_option line
04049          *
04050          * 1.8 MGS generates config. commands like this:
04051          *   #06 (104)mount_option 0:  1:lustre-MDT0000  2:lustre-mdtlov
04052          *   #08 (120)setup   0:lustre-MDT0000  1:dev 2:type 3:lustre-MDT0000
04053          * 2.0 MGS generates config. commands like this:
04054          *   #07 (112)mount_option 0:  1:lustre-MDT0000  2:lustre-MDT0000-mdtlov
04055          *   #08 (160)setup   0:lustre-MDT0000  1:lustre-MDT0000_UUID  2:0
04056          *                    3:lustre-MDT0000-mdtlov  4:f
04057          *
04058          * we generate MDD name from MDT one, just replacing T with D
04059          *
04060          * after all the preparations, the logical equivalent will be
04061          *   #01 (160)setup   0:lustre-MDD0000  1:lustre-MDD0000_UUID  2:0
04062          *                    3:lustre-MDT0000-mdtlov  4:f
04063          *   #02 (160)setup   0:lustre-MDT0000  1:lustre-MDT0000_UUID  2:0
04064          *                    3:lustre-MDD0000  4:f
04065          *
04066          *  notice we build the stack from down to top: MDD first, then MDT */
04067 
04068         name_size = MAX_OBD_NAME;
04069         uuid_size = MAX_OBD_NAME;
04070 
04071         OBD_ALLOC(name, name_size);
04072         OBD_ALLOC(uuid, uuid_size);
04073         if (name == NULL || uuid == NULL)
04074                 GOTO(cleanup_mem, rc = -ENOMEM);
04075 
04076         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
04077         if (!bufs)
04078                 GOTO(cleanup_mem, rc = -ENOMEM);
04079 
04080         strcpy(name, dev);
04081         p = strstr(name, "-MDT");
04082         if (p == NULL)
04083                 GOTO(free_bufs, rc = -ENOMEM);
04084         p[3] = 'D';
04085 
04086         snprintf(uuid, MAX_OBD_NAME, "%s_UUID", name);
04087 
04088         lprof = class_get_profile(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04089         if (lprof == NULL || lprof->lp_dt == NULL) {
04090                 CERROR("can't find the profile: %s\n",
04091                        lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04092                 GOTO(free_bufs, rc = -EINVAL);
04093         }
04094 
04095         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, name);
04096         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, LUSTRE_MDD_NAME);
04097         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 2, uuid);
04098         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 3, lprof->lp_dt);
04099 
04100         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ATTACH, bufs);
04101         if (lcfg == NULL)
04102                 GOTO(put_profile, rc = -ENOMEM);
04103 
04104         rc = class_attach(lcfg);
04105         if (rc)
04106                 GOTO(lcfg_cleanup, rc);
04107 
04108         obd = class_name2obd(name);
04109         if (!obd) {
04110                 CERROR("Can not find obd %s (%s in config)\n",
04111                        MDD_OBD_NAME, lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04112                 GOTO(lcfg_cleanup, rc = -EINVAL);
04113         }
04114 
04115         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
04116 
04117         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, name);
04118         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, uuid);
04119         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 2, dev);
04120         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 3, lprof->lp_dt);
04121 
04122         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SETUP, bufs);
04123         if (lcfg == NULL)
04124                 GOTO(class_detach, rc = -ENOMEM);
04125 
04126         rc = class_setup(obd, lcfg);
04127         if (rc)
04128                 GOTO(class_detach, rc);
04129 
04130         /* connect to MDD we just setup */
04131         rc = mdt_connect_to_next(env, mdt, name, &mdt->mdt_child_exp);
04132         if (rc)
04133                 GOTO(class_detach, rc);
04134 
04135         site = mdt->mdt_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
04136         LASSERT(site);
04137         LASSERT(mdt_lu_site(mdt) == NULL);
04138         mdt->mdt_lu_dev.ld_site = site;
04139         site->ls_top_dev = &mdt->mdt_lu_dev;
04140         mdt->mdt_child = lu2md_dev(mdt->mdt_child_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
04141 
04142         /* now connect to bottom OSD */
04143         snprintf(name, MAX_OBD_NAME, "%s-osd", dev);
04144         rc = mdt_connect_to_next(env, mdt, name, &mdt->mdt_bottom_exp);
04145         if (rc)
04146                 GOTO(class_detach, rc);
04147         mdt->mdt_bottom =
04148                 lu2dt_dev(mdt->mdt_bottom_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
04149 
04150         rc = lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
04151         if (rc != 0)
04152                 CERROR("Failure to refill session: '%d'\n", rc);
04153 
04154         lu_dev_add_linkage(site, &mdt->mdt_lu_dev);
04155 
04156         EXIT;
04157 class_detach:
04158         if (rc)
04159                 class_detach(obd, lcfg);
04160 lcfg_cleanup:
04161         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
04162 put_profile:
04163         class_put_profile(lprof);
04164 free_bufs:
04165         OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
04166 cleanup_mem:
04167         if (name)
04168                 OBD_FREE(name, name_size);
04169         if (uuid)
04170                 OBD_FREE(uuid, uuid_size);
04171         RETURN(rc);
04172 }
04173 
04174 /* setup quota master target on MDT0 */
04175 static int mdt_quota_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *mdt,
04176                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
04177 {
04178         struct obd_device       *obd;
04179         char                    *dev = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
04180         char                    *qmtname, *uuid, *p;
04181         struct lustre_cfg_bufs  *bufs;
04182         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
04183         struct lustre_profile   *lprof;
04184         struct obd_connect_data *data;
04185         int                      rc;
04186         ENTRY;
04187 
04188         LASSERT(mdt->mdt_qmt_exp == NULL);
04189         LASSERT(mdt->mdt_qmt_dev == NULL);
04190 
04191         /* quota master is on MDT0 only for now */
04192         if (mdt->mdt_seq_site.ss_node_id != 0)
04193                 RETURN(0);
04194 
04195         /* MGS generates config commands which look as follows:
04196          *   #01 (160)setup   0:lustre-MDT0000  1:lustre-MDT0000_UUID  2:0
04197          *                    3:lustre-MDT0000-mdtlov  4:f
04198          *
04199          * We generate the QMT name from the MDT one, just replacing MD with QM
04200          * after all the preparations, the logical equivalent will be:
04201          *   #01 (160)setup   0:lustre-QMT0000  1:lustre-QMT0000_UUID  2:0
04202          *                    3:lustre-MDT0000-osd  4:f */
04203         OBD_ALLOC(qmtname, MAX_OBD_NAME);
04204         OBD_ALLOC(uuid, UUID_MAX);
04205         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(bufs);
04206         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
04207         if (qmtname == NULL || uuid == NULL || bufs == NULL || data == NULL)
04208                 GOTO(cleanup_mem, rc = -ENOMEM);
04209 
04210         strcpy(qmtname, dev);
04211         p = strstr(qmtname, "-MDT");
04212         if (p == NULL)
04213                 GOTO(cleanup_mem, rc = -ENOMEM);
04214         /* replace MD with QM */
04215         p[1] = 'Q';
04216         p[2] = 'M';
04217 
04218         snprintf(uuid, UUID_MAX, "%s_UUID", qmtname);
04219 
04220         lprof = class_get_profile(lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04221         if (lprof == NULL || lprof->lp_dt == NULL) {
04222                 CERROR("can't find profile for %s\n",
04223                        lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04224                 GOTO(cleanup_mem, rc = -EINVAL);
04225         }
04226 
04227         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, qmtname);
04228         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, LUSTRE_QMT_NAME);
04229         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 2, uuid);
04230         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 3, lprof->lp_dt);
04231 
04232         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_ATTACH, bufs);
04233         if (lcfg == NULL)
04234                 GOTO(put_profile, rc = -ENOMEM);
04235 
04236         rc = class_attach(lcfg);
04237         if (rc)
04238                 GOTO(lcfg_cleanup, rc);
04239 
04240         obd = class_name2obd(qmtname);
04241         if (!obd) {
04242                 CERROR("Can not find obd %s (%s in config)\n", qmtname,
04243                        lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
04244                 GOTO(lcfg_cleanup, rc = -EINVAL);
04245         }
04246 
04247         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
04248 
04249         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(bufs, qmtname);
04250         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 1, uuid);
04251         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 2, dev);
04252 
04253         /* for quota, the next device should be the OSD device */
04254         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(bufs, 3,
04255                                    mdt->mdt_bottom->dd_lu_dev.ld_obd->obd_name);
04256 
04257         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_SETUP, bufs);
04258         if (lcfg == NULL)
04259                 GOTO(class_detach, rc = -ENOMEM);
04260 
04261         rc = class_setup(obd, lcfg);
04262         if (rc)
04263                 GOTO(class_detach, rc);
04264 
04265         mdt->mdt_qmt_dev = obd->obd_lu_dev;
04266 
04267         /* configure local quota objects */
04268         rc = mdt->mdt_qmt_dev->ld_ops->ldo_prepare(env,
04269                                                    &mdt->mdt_lu_dev,
04270                                                    mdt->mdt_qmt_dev);
04271         if (rc)
04272                 GOTO(class_cleanup, rc);
04273 
04274         /* connect to quota master target */
04275         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
04276         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
04277         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &mdt->mdt_qmt_exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid,
04278                          data, NULL);
04279         if (rc) {
04280                 CERROR("cannot connect to quota master device %s (%d)\n",
04281                        qmtname, rc);
04282                 GOTO(class_cleanup, rc);
04283         }
04284 
04285         EXIT;
04286 class_cleanup:
04287         if (rc) {
04288                 class_manual_cleanup(obd);
04289                 mdt->mdt_qmt_dev = NULL;
04290         }
04291 class_detach:
04292         if (rc)
04293                 class_detach(obd, lcfg);
04294 lcfg_cleanup:
04295         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
04296 put_profile:
04297         class_put_profile(lprof);
04298 cleanup_mem:
04299         if (bufs)
04300                 OBD_FREE_PTR(bufs);
04301         if (qmtname)
04302                 OBD_FREE(qmtname, MAX_OBD_NAME);
04303         if (uuid)
04304                 OBD_FREE(uuid, UUID_MAX);
04305         if (data)
04306                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
04307         return rc;
04308 }
04309 
04310 /* Shutdown quota master target associated with mdt */
04311 static void mdt_quota_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *mdt)
04312 {
04313         ENTRY;
04314 
04315         if (mdt->mdt_qmt_exp == NULL)
04316                 RETURN_EXIT;
04317         LASSERT(mdt->mdt_qmt_dev != NULL);
04318 
04319         /* the qmt automatically shuts down when the mdt disconnects */
04320         obd_disconnect(mdt->mdt_qmt_exp);
04321         mdt->mdt_qmt_exp = NULL;
04322         mdt->mdt_qmt_dev = NULL;
04323         EXIT;
04324 }
04325 
04326 /* mdt_getxattr() is used from mdt_intent_getxattr(), use this wrapper
04327  * for now. This will be removed along with converting rest of MDT code
04328  * to use tgt_session_info */
04329 static int mdt_tgt_getxattr(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
04330 {
04331         struct mdt_thread_info  *info = tsi2mdt_info(tsi);
04332         int                      rc;
04333 
04334         rc = mdt_getxattr(info);
04335 
04336         mdt_thread_info_fini(info);
04337         return rc;
04338 }

04446 
04447 static void mdt_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *m)
04448 {
04449         struct md_device        *next = m->mdt_child;
04450         struct lu_device        *d    = &m->mdt_lu_dev;
04451         struct obd_device       *obd  = mdt2obd_dev(m);
04452         struct lfsck_stop        stop;
04453         ENTRY;
04454 
04455         stop.ls_status = LS_PAUSED;
04456         stop.ls_flags = 0;
04457         next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(env, next, OBD_IOC_STOP_LFSCK, 0, &stop);
04458 
04459         mdt_stack_pre_fini(env, m, md2lu_dev(m->mdt_child));
04460         target_recovery_fini(obd);
04461         ping_evictor_stop();
04462 
04463         if (m->mdt_opts.mo_coordinator)
04464                 mdt_hsm_cdt_stop(m);
04465 
04466         mdt_hsm_cdt_fini(m);
04467 
04468         mdt_llog_ctxt_unclone(env, m, LLOG_AGENT_ORIG_CTXT);
04469         mdt_llog_ctxt_unclone(env, m, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
04470 
04471         if (m->mdt_namespace != NULL)
04472                 ldlm_namespace_free_prior(m->mdt_namespace, NULL,
04473                                           d->ld_obd->obd_force);
04474 
04475         obd_exports_barrier(obd);
04476         obd_zombie_barrier();
04477 
04478         mdt_procfs_fini(m);
04479 
04480         tgt_fini(env, &m->mdt_lut);
04481         mdt_fs_cleanup(env, m);
04482         upcall_cache_cleanup(m->mdt_identity_cache);
04483         m->mdt_identity_cache = NULL;
04484 
04485         if (m->mdt_namespace != NULL) {
04486                 ldlm_namespace_free_post(m->mdt_namespace);
04487                 d->ld_obd->obd_namespace = m->mdt_namespace = NULL;
04488         }
04489 
04490         mdt_quota_fini(env, m);
04491 
04492         cfs_free_nidlist(&m->mdt_squash.rsi_nosquash_nids);
04493 
04494         mdt_seq_fini(env, m);
04495         mdt_fld_fini(env, m);
04496 
04497         /*
04498          * Finish the stack
04499          */
04500         mdt_stack_fini(env, m, md2lu_dev(m->mdt_child));
04501 
04502         LASSERT(atomic_read(&d->ld_ref) == 0);
04503 
04504         server_put_mount(mdt_obd_name(m), true);
04505 
04506         EXIT;
04507 }
04508 
04509 static int mdt_postrecov(const struct lu_env *, struct mdt_device *);
04510 
04511 static int mdt_init0(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *m,
04512                      struct lu_device_type *ldt, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
04513 {
04514         struct mdt_thread_info    *info;
04515         struct obd_device         *obd;
04516         const char                *dev = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
04517         const char                *num = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 2);
04518         struct lustre_mount_info  *lmi = NULL;
04519         struct lustre_sb_info     *lsi;
04520         struct lu_site            *s;
04521         struct seq_server_site    *ss_site;
04522         const char                *identity_upcall = "NONE";
04523         struct md_device          *next;
04524         int                        rc;
04525         long                       node_id;
04526         mntopt_t                   mntopts;
04527         ENTRY;
04528 
04529         lu_device_init(&m->mdt_lu_dev, ldt);
04530         /*
04531          * Environment (env) might be missing mdt_thread_key values at that
04532          * point, if device is allocated when mdt_thread_key is in QUIESCENT
04533          * mode.
04534          *
04535          * Usually device allocation path doesn't use module key values, but
04536          * mdt has to do a lot of work here, so allocate key value.
04537          */
04538         rc = lu_env_refill((struct lu_env *)env);
04539         if (rc != 0)
04540                 RETURN(rc);
04541 
04542         info = lu_context_key_get(&env->le_ctx, &mdt_thread_key);
04543         LASSERT(info != NULL);
04544 
04545         obd = class_name2obd(dev);
04546         LASSERT(obd != NULL);
04547 
04548         m->mdt_max_mdsize = MAX_MD_SIZE; /* 4 stripes */
04549         m->mdt_opts.mo_evict_tgt_nids = 1;
04550         m->mdt_opts.mo_cos = MDT_COS_DEFAULT;
04551 
04552         /* default is coordinator off, it is started through conf_param
04553          * or /proc */
04554         m->mdt_opts.mo_coordinator = 0;
04555 
04556         lmi = server_get_mount(dev);
04557         if (lmi == NULL) {
04558                 CERROR("Cannot get mount info for %s!\n", dev);
04559                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
04560         } else {
04561                 lsi = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb);
04562                 /* CMD is supported only in IAM mode */
04563                 LASSERT(num);
04564                 node_id = simple_strtol(num, NULL, 10);
04565                 obd->u.obt.obt_magic = OBT_MAGIC;
04566                 if (lsi->lsi_lmd != NULL &&
04567                     lsi->lsi_lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_SKIP_LFSCK)
04568                         m->mdt_skip_lfsck = 1;
04569         }
04570 
04571         m->mdt_squash.rsi_uid = 0;
04572         m->mdt_squash.rsi_gid = 0;
04573         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&m->mdt_squash.rsi_nosquash_nids);
04574         init_rwsem(&m->mdt_squash.rsi_sem);
04575         spin_lock_init(&m->mdt_osfs_lock);
04576         m->mdt_osfs_age = cfs_time_shift_64(-1000);
04577         m->mdt_enable_remote_dir = 0;
04578         m->mdt_enable_remote_dir_gid = 0;
04579 
04580         atomic_set(&m->mdt_mds_mds_conns, 0);
04581         atomic_set(&m->mdt_async_commit_count, 0);
04582 
04583         m->mdt_lu_dev.ld_ops = &mdt_lu_ops;
04584         m->mdt_lu_dev.ld_obd = obd;
04585         /* Set this lu_device to obd for error handling purposes. */
04586         obd->obd_lu_dev = &m->mdt_lu_dev;
04587 
04588         /* init the stack */
04589         rc = mdt_stack_init((struct lu_env *)env, m, cfg);
04590         if (rc) {
04591                 CERROR("%s: Can't init device stack, rc %d\n",
04592                        mdt_obd_name(m), rc);
04593                 GOTO(err_lmi, rc);
04594         }
04595 
04596         s = mdt_lu_site(m);
04597         ss_site = mdt_seq_site(m);
04598         s->ld_seq_site = ss_site;
04599         ss_site->ss_lu = s;
04600 
04601         /* set server index */
04602         ss_site->ss_node_id = node_id;
04603 
04604         /* failover is the default
04605          * FIXME: we do not failout mds0/mgs, which may cause some problems.
04606          * assumed whose ss_node_id == 0 XXX
04607          * */
04608         obd->obd_replayable = 1;
04609         /* No connection accepted until configurations will finish */
04610         obd->obd_no_conn = 1;
04611 
04612         if (cfg->lcfg_bufcount > 4 && LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(cfg, 4) > 0) {
04613                 char *str = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 4);
04614                 if (strchr(str, 'n')) {
04615                         CWARN("%s: recovery disabled\n", mdt_obd_name(m));
04616                         obd->obd_replayable = 0;
04617                 }
04618         }
04619 
04620         rc = mdt_fld_init(env, mdt_obd_name(m), m);
04621         if (rc)
04622                 GOTO(err_fini_stack, rc);
04623 
04624         rc = mdt_seq_init(env, m);
04625         if (rc)
04626                 GOTO(err_fini_fld, rc);
04627 
04628         snprintf(info->mti_u.ns_name, sizeof(info->mti_u.ns_name), "%s-%s",
04629                  LUSTRE_MDT_NAME, obd->obd_uuid.uuid);
04630         m->mdt_namespace = ldlm_namespace_new(obd, info->mti_u.ns_name,
04631                                               LDLM_NAMESPACE_SERVER,
04632                                               LDLM_NAMESPACE_GREEDY,
04633                                               LDLM_NS_TYPE_MDT);
04634         if (m->mdt_namespace == NULL)
04635                 GOTO(err_fini_seq, rc = -ENOMEM);
04636 
04637         m->mdt_namespace->ns_lvbp = m;
04638         m->mdt_namespace->ns_lvbo = &mdt_lvbo;
04639 
04640         ldlm_register_intent(m->mdt_namespace, mdt_intent_policy);
04641         /* set obd_namespace for compatibility with old code */
04642         obd->obd_namespace = m->mdt_namespace;
04643 
04644         rc = mdt_hsm_cdt_init(m);
04645         if (rc != 0) {
04646                 CERROR("%s: error initializing coordinator, rc %d\n",
04647                        mdt_obd_name(m), rc);
04648                 GOTO(err_free_ns, rc);
04649         }
04650 
04651         rc = tgt_init(env, &m->mdt_lut, obd, m->mdt_bottom, mdt_common_slice,
04652                       OBD_FAIL_MDS_ALL_REQUEST_NET,
04653                       OBD_FAIL_MDS_ALL_REPLY_NET);
04654         if (rc)
04655                 GOTO(err_free_hsm, rc);
04656 
04657         rc = mdt_fs_setup(env, m, obd, lsi);
04658         if (rc)
04659                 GOTO(err_tgt, rc);
04660 
04661         tgt_adapt_sptlrpc_conf(&m->mdt_lut, 1);
04662 
04663         next = m->mdt_child;
04664         rc = next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(env, next, OBD_IOC_GET_MNTOPT, 0,
04665                                          &mntopts);
04666         if (rc)
04667                 GOTO(err_fs_cleanup, rc);
04668 
04669         if (mntopts & MNTOPT_USERXATTR)
04670                 m->mdt_opts.mo_user_xattr = 1;
04671         else
04672                 m->mdt_opts.mo_user_xattr = 0;
04673 
04674         rc = next->md_ops->mdo_maxeasize_get(env, next, &m->mdt_max_ea_size);
04675         if (rc)
04676                 GOTO(err_fs_cleanup, rc);
04677 
04678         if (mntopts & MNTOPT_ACL)
04679                 m->mdt_opts.mo_acl = 1;
04680         else
04681                 m->mdt_opts.mo_acl = 0;
04682 
04683         /* XXX: to support suppgid for ACL, we enable identity_upcall
04684          * by default, otherwise, maybe got unexpected -EACCESS. */
04685         if (m->mdt_opts.mo_acl)
04686                 identity_upcall = MDT_IDENTITY_UPCALL_PATH;
04687 
04688         m->mdt_identity_cache = upcall_cache_init(mdt_obd_name(m),
04689                                                 identity_upcall,
04690                                                 &mdt_identity_upcall_cache_ops);
04691         if (IS_ERR(m->mdt_identity_cache)) {
04692                 rc = PTR_ERR(m->mdt_identity_cache);
04693                 m->mdt_identity_cache = NULL;
04694                 GOTO(err_fs_cleanup, rc);
04695         }
04696 
04697         rc = mdt_procfs_init(m, dev);
04698         if (rc) {
04699                 CERROR("Can't init MDT lprocfs, rc %d\n", rc);
04700                 GOTO(err_recovery, rc);
04701         }
04702 
04703         rc = mdt_quota_init(env, m, cfg);
04704         if (rc)
04705                 GOTO(err_procfs, rc);
04706 
04707         m->mdt_ldlm_client = &mdt2obd_dev(m)->obd_ldlm_client;
04708         ptlrpc_init_client(LDLM_CB_REQUEST_PORTAL, LDLM_CB_REPLY_PORTAL,
04709                            "mdt_ldlm_client", m->mdt_ldlm_client);
04710 
04711         ping_evictor_start();
04712 
04713         /* recovery will be started upon mdt_prepare()
04714          * when the whole stack is complete and ready
04715          * to serve the requests */
04716 
04717         /* Reduce the initial timeout on an MDS because it doesn't need such
04718          * a long timeout as an OST does. Adaptive timeouts will adjust this
04719          * value appropriately. */
04720         if (ldlm_timeout == LDLM_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT)
04721                 ldlm_timeout = MDS_LDLM_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT;
04722 
04723         RETURN(0);
04724 err_procfs:
04725         mdt_procfs_fini(m);
04726 err_recovery:
04727         target_recovery_fini(obd);
04728         upcall_cache_cleanup(m->mdt_identity_cache);
04729         m->mdt_identity_cache = NULL;
04730 err_fs_cleanup:
04731         mdt_fs_cleanup(env, m);
04732 err_tgt:
04733         tgt_fini(env, &m->mdt_lut);
04734 err_free_hsm:
04735         mdt_hsm_cdt_fini(m);
04736 err_free_ns:
04737         ldlm_namespace_free(m->mdt_namespace, NULL, 0);
04738         obd->obd_namespace = m->mdt_namespace = NULL;
04739 err_fini_seq:
04740         mdt_seq_fini(env, m);
04741 err_fini_fld:
04742         mdt_fld_fini(env, m);
04743 err_fini_stack:
04744         mdt_stack_fini(env, m, md2lu_dev(m->mdt_child));
04745 err_lmi:
04746         if (lmi)
04747                 server_put_mount(dev, true);
04748         return(rc);
04749 }
04750 
04751 /* For interoperability, the left element is old parameter, the right one
04752  * is the new version of the parameter, if some parameter is deprecated,
04753  * the new version should be set as NULL. */
04754 static struct cfg_interop_param mdt_interop_param[] = {
04755         { "mdt.group_upcall",   NULL },
04756         { "mdt.quota_type",     NULL },
04757         { "mdd.quota_type",     NULL },
04758         { "mdt.som",            NULL },
04759         { "mdt.rootsquash",     "mdt.root_squash" },
04760         { "mdt.nosquash_nid",   "mdt.nosquash_nids" },
04761         { NULL }
04762 };
04763 
04764 /* used by MGS to process specific configurations */
04765 static int mdt_process_config(const struct lu_env *env,
04766                               struct lu_device *d, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
04767 {
04768         struct mdt_device *m = mdt_dev(d);
04769         struct md_device *md_next = m->mdt_child;
04770         struct lu_device *next = md2lu_dev(md_next);
04771         int rc;
04772         ENTRY;
04773 
04774         switch (cfg->lcfg_command) {
04775         case LCFG_PARAM: {
04776                 struct obd_device          *obd = d->ld_obd;
04777 
04778                 /* For interoperability */
04779                 struct cfg_interop_param   *ptr = NULL;
04780                 struct lustre_cfg          *old_cfg = NULL;
04781                 char                       *param = NULL;
04782 
04783                 param = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1);
04784                 if (param == NULL) {
04785                         CERROR("param is empty\n");
04786                         rc = -EINVAL;
04787                         break;
04788                 }
04789 
04790                 ptr = class_find_old_param(param, mdt_interop_param);
04791                 if (ptr != NULL) {
04792                         if (ptr->new_param == NULL) {
04793                                 rc = 0;
04794                                 CWARN("For interoperability, skip this %s."
04795                                       " It is obsolete.\n", ptr->old_param);
04796                                 break;
04797                         }
04798 
04799                         CWARN("Found old param %s, changed it to %s.\n",
04800                               ptr->old_param, ptr->new_param);
04801 
04802                         old_cfg = cfg;
04803                         cfg = lustre_cfg_rename(old_cfg, ptr->new_param);
04804                         if (IS_ERR(cfg)) {
04805                                 rc = PTR_ERR(cfg);
04806                                 break;
04807                         }
04808                 }
04809 
04810                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_MDT, obd->obd_vars,
04811                                               cfg, obd);
04812                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS) {
04813                         /* is it an HSM var ? */
04814                         rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_HSM,
04815                                                       hsm_cdt_get_proc_vars(),
04816                                                       cfg, obd);
04817                         if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS)
04818                                 /* we don't understand; pass it on */
04819                                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next,
04820                                                                       cfg);
04821                 }
04822 
04823                 if (old_cfg != NULL)
04824                         lustre_cfg_free(cfg);
04825 
04826                 break;
04827         }
04828         default:
04829                 /* others are passed further */
04830                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
04831                 break;
04832         }
04833         RETURN(rc);
04834 }
04835 
04836 static struct lu_object *mdt_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
04837                                           const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
04838                                           struct lu_device *d)
04839 {
04840         struct mdt_object *mo;
04841 
04842         ENTRY;
04843 
04844         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(mo, mdt_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
04845         if (mo != NULL) {
04846                 struct lu_object *o;
04847                 struct lu_object_header *h;
04848 
04849                 o = &mo->mot_obj;
04850                 h = &mo->mot_header;
04851                 lu_object_header_init(h);
04852                 lu_object_init(o, h, d);
04853                 lu_object_add_top(h, o);
04854                 o->lo_ops = &mdt_obj_ops;
04855                 spin_lock_init(&mo->mot_write_lock);
04856                 mutex_init(&mo->mot_lov_mutex);
04857                 init_rwsem(&mo->mot_open_sem);
04858                 RETURN(o);
04859         }
04860         RETURN(NULL);
04861 }
04862 
04863 static int mdt_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o,
04864                            const struct lu_object_conf *unused)
04865 {
04866         struct mdt_device *d = mdt_dev(o->lo_dev);
04867         struct lu_device  *under;
04868         struct lu_object  *below;
04869         int                rc = 0;
04870         ENTRY;
04871 
04872         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "object init, fid = "DFID"\n",
04873                PFID(lu_object_fid(o)));
04874 
04875         under = &d->mdt_child->md_lu_dev;
04876         below = under->ld_ops->ldo_object_alloc(env, o->lo_header, under);
04877         if (below != NULL) {
04878                 lu_object_add(o, below);
04879         } else
04880                 rc = -ENOMEM;
04881 
04882         RETURN(rc);
04883 }
04884 
04885 static void mdt_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
04886 {
04887         struct mdt_object *mo = mdt_obj(o);
04888         struct lu_object_header *h;
04889         ENTRY;
04890 
04891         h = o->lo_header;
04892         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "object free, fid = "DFID"\n",
04893                PFID(lu_object_fid(o)));
04894 
04895         LASSERT(atomic_read(&mo->mot_open_count) == 0);
04896         LASSERT(atomic_read(&mo->mot_lease_count) == 0);
04897 
04898         lu_object_fini(o);
04899         lu_object_header_fini(h);
04900         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(mo, mdt_object_kmem);
04901 
04902         EXIT;
04903 }
04904 
04905 static int mdt_object_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
04906                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)
04907 {
04908         struct mdt_object *mdto = mdt_obj((struct lu_object *)o);
04909 
04910         return (*p)(env, cookie,
04911                     LUSTRE_MDT_NAME"-object@%p(flags=%d, writecount=%d)",
04912                     mdto, mdto->mot_flags, mdto->mot_write_count);
04913 }
04914 
04915 static int mdt_prepare(const struct lu_env *env,
04916                 struct lu_device *pdev,
04917                 struct lu_device *cdev)
04918 {
04919         struct mdt_device *mdt = mdt_dev(cdev);
04920         struct lu_device *next = &mdt->mdt_child->md_lu_dev;
04921         struct obd_device *obd = cdev->ld_obd;
04922         int rc;
04923 
04924         ENTRY;
04925 
04926         LASSERT(obd);
04927 
04928         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_prepare(env, cdev, next);
04929         if (rc)
04930                 RETURN(rc);
04931 
04932         rc = mdt_llog_ctxt_clone(env, mdt, LLOG_CHANGELOG_ORIG_CTXT);
04933         if (rc)
04934                 RETURN(rc);
04935 
04936         rc = mdt_llog_ctxt_clone(env, mdt, LLOG_AGENT_ORIG_CTXT);
04937         if (rc)
04938                 RETURN(rc);
04939 
04940         rc = lfsck_register_namespace(env, mdt->mdt_bottom, mdt->mdt_namespace);
04941         /* The LFSCK instance is registered just now, so it must be there when
04942          * register the namespace to such instance. */
04943         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "register namespace failed: rc = %d\n", rc);
04944 
04945         if (mdt->mdt_seq_site.ss_node_id == 0) {
04946                 rc = mdt->mdt_child->md_ops->mdo_root_get(env, mdt->mdt_child,
04947                                                          &mdt->mdt_md_root_fid);
04948                 if (rc)
04949                         RETURN(rc);
04950         }
04951 
04952         LASSERT(!test_bit(MDT_FL_CFGLOG, &mdt->mdt_state));
04953 
04954         target_recovery_init(&mdt->mdt_lut, tgt_request_handle);
04955         set_bit(MDT_FL_CFGLOG, &mdt->mdt_state);
04956         LASSERT(obd->obd_no_conn);
04957         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
04958         obd->obd_no_conn = 0;
04959         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
04960 
04961         if (obd->obd_recovering == 0)
04962                 mdt_postrecov(env, mdt);
04963 
04964         RETURN(rc);
04965 }
04966 
04967 const struct lu_device_operations mdt_lu_ops = {
04968         .ldo_object_alloc   = mdt_object_alloc,
04969         .ldo_process_config = mdt_process_config,
04970         .ldo_prepare        = mdt_prepare,
04971 };
04972 
04973 static const struct lu_object_operations mdt_obj_ops = {
04974         .loo_object_init    = mdt_object_init,
04975         .loo_object_free    = mdt_object_free,
04976         .loo_object_print   = mdt_object_print
04977 };
04978 
04979 static int mdt_obd_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env,
04980                                   struct obd_export *exp,
04981                                   __u32 keylen, void *key,
04982                                   __u32 vallen, void *val,
04983                                   struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
04984 {
04985         int rc;
04986 
04987         ENTRY;
04988 
04989         if (KEY_IS(KEY_SPTLRPC_CONF)) {
04990                 rc = tgt_adapt_sptlrpc_conf(class_exp2tgt(exp), 0);
04991                 RETURN(rc);
04992         }
04993 
04994         RETURN(0);
04995 }
04996 
05018 static int mdt_connect_internal(struct obd_export *exp,
05019                                 struct mdt_device *mdt,
05020                                 struct obd_connect_data *data)
05021 {
05022         LASSERT(data != NULL);
05023 
05024         data->ocd_connect_flags &= MDT_CONNECT_SUPPORTED;
05025         data->ocd_ibits_known &= MDS_INODELOCK_FULL;
05026 
05027         if (!(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) &&
05028             !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_IBITS)) {
05029                 CWARN("%s: client %s does not support ibits lock, either "
05030                       "very old or an invalid client: flags "LPX64"\n",
05031                       mdt_obd_name(mdt), exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
05032                       data->ocd_connect_flags);
05033                 return -EBADE;
05034         }
05035 
05036         if (!mdt->mdt_opts.mo_acl)
05037                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_ACL;
05038 
05039         if (!mdt->mdt_opts.mo_user_xattr)
05040                 data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_XATTR;
05041 
05042         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_BRW_SIZE) {
05043                 data->ocd_brw_size = min(data->ocd_brw_size,
05044                                          (__u32)MD_MAX_BRW_SIZE);
05045                 if (data->ocd_brw_size == 0) {
05046                         CERROR("%s: cli %s/%p ocd_connect_flags: "LPX64
05047                                " ocd_version: %x ocd_grant: %d "
05048                                "ocd_index: %u ocd_brw_size is "
05049                                "unexpectedly zero, network data "
05050                                "corruption? Refusing connection of this"
05051                                " client\n",
05052                                mdt_obd_name(mdt),
05053                                exp->exp_client_uuid.uuid,
05054                                exp, data->ocd_connect_flags, data->ocd_version,
05055                                data->ocd_grant, data->ocd_index);
05056                         return -EPROTO;
05057                 }
05058         }
05059 
05060         /* NB: Disregard the rule against updating
05061          * exp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags in this case, since
05062          * tgt_client_new() needs to know if this is a lightweight
05063          * connection, and it is safe to expose this flag before
05064          * connection processing completes. */
05065         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT) {
05066                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
05067                 *exp_connect_flags_ptr(exp) |= OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT;
05068                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
05069         }
05070 
05071         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
05072 
05073         if ((data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_FID) == 0) {
05074                 CWARN("%s: MDS requires FID support, but client not\n",
05075                       mdt_obd_name(mdt));
05076                 return -EBADE;
05077         }
05078 
05079         if (OCD_HAS_FLAG(data, PINGLESS)) {
05080                 if (ptlrpc_pinger_suppress_pings()) {
05081                         spin_lock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
05082                         list_del_init(&exp->exp_obd_chain_timed);
05083                         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
05084                 } else {
05085                         data->ocd_connect_flags &= ~OBD_CONNECT_PINGLESS;
05086                 }
05087         }
05088 
05089         data->ocd_max_easize = mdt->mdt_max_ea_size;
05090 
05091         /* NB: Disregard the rule against updating
05092          * exp_connect_data.ocd_connect_flags in this case, since
05093          * tgt_client_new() needs to know if this is client supports
05094          * multiple modify RPCs, and it is safe to expose this flag before
05095          * connection processing completes. */
05096         if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS) {
05097                 data->ocd_maxmodrpcs = max_mod_rpcs_per_client;
05098                 spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
05099                 *exp_connect_flags_ptr(exp) |= OBD_CONNECT_MULTIMODRPCS;
05100                 spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
05101         }
05102 
05103         return 0;
05104 }
05105 
05106 static int mdt_ctxt_add_dirty_flag(struct lu_env *env,
05107                                    struct mdt_thread_info *info,
05108                                    struct mdt_file_data *mfd)
05109 {
05110         struct lu_context ses;
05111         int rc;
05112         ENTRY;
05113 
05114         rc = lu_context_init(&ses, LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
05115         if (rc)
05116                 RETURN(rc);
05117 
05118         env->le_ses = &ses;
05119         lu_context_enter(&ses);
05120 
05121         mdt_ucred(info)->uc_valid = UCRED_OLD;
05122         rc = mdt_add_dirty_flag(info, mfd->mfd_object, &info->mti_attr);
05123 
05124         lu_context_exit(&ses);
05125         lu_context_fini(&ses);
05126         env->le_ses = NULL;
05127 
05128         RETURN(rc);
05129 }
05130 
05131 static int mdt_export_cleanup(struct obd_export *exp)
05132 {
05133         struct list_head         closing_list;
05134         struct mdt_export_data  *med = &exp->exp_mdt_data;
05135         struct obd_device       *obd = exp->exp_obd;
05136         struct mdt_device       *mdt;
05137         struct mdt_thread_info  *info;
05138         struct lu_env            env;
05139         struct mdt_file_data    *mfd, *n;
05140         int rc = 0;
05141         ENTRY;
05142 
05143         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&closing_list);
05144         spin_lock(&med->med_open_lock);
05145         while (!list_empty(&med->med_open_head)) {
05146                 struct list_head *tmp = med->med_open_head.next;
05147                 mfd = list_entry(tmp, struct mdt_file_data, mfd_list);
05148 
05149                 /* Remove mfd handle so it can't be found again.
05150                  * We are consuming the mfd_list reference here. */
05151                 class_handle_unhash(&mfd->mfd_handle);
05152                 list_move_tail(&mfd->mfd_list, &closing_list);
05153         }
05154         spin_unlock(&med->med_open_lock);
05155         mdt = mdt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
05156         LASSERT(mdt != NULL);
05157 
05158         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_MD_THREAD);
05159         if (rc)
05160                 RETURN(rc);
05161 
05162         info = lu_context_key_get(&env.le_ctx, &mdt_thread_key);
05163         LASSERT(info != NULL);
05164         memset(info, 0, sizeof *info);
05165         info->mti_env = &env;
05166         info->mti_mdt = mdt;
05167         info->mti_exp = exp;
05168 
05169         if (!list_empty(&closing_list)) {
05170                 struct md_attr *ma = &info->mti_attr;
05171 
05172                 /* Close any open files (which may also cause orphan
05173                  * unlinking). */
05174                 list_for_each_entry_safe(mfd, n, &closing_list, mfd_list) {
05175                         list_del_init(&mfd->mfd_list);
05176                         ma->ma_need = ma->ma_valid = 0;
05177 
05178                         /* This file is being closed due to an eviction, it
05179                          * could have been modified and now dirty regarding to
05180                          * HSM archive, check this!
05181                          * The logic here is to mark a file dirty if there's a
05182                          * chance it was dirtied before the client was evicted,
05183                          * so that we don't have to wait for a release attempt
05184                          * before finding out the file was actually dirty and
05185                          * fail the release. Aggressively marking it dirty here
05186                          * will cause the policy engine to attempt to
05187                          * re-archive it; when rearchiving, we can compare the
05188                          * current version to the HSM data_version and make the
05189                          * archive request into a noop if it's not actually
05190                          * dirty.
05191                          */
05192                         if (mfd->mfd_mode & FMODE_WRITE)
05193                                 rc = mdt_ctxt_add_dirty_flag(&env, info, mfd);
05194 
05195                         /* Don't unlink orphan on failover umount, LU-184 */
05196                         if (exp->exp_flags & OBD_OPT_FAILOVER) {
05197                                 ma->ma_valid = MA_FLAGS;
05198                                 ma->ma_attr_flags |= MDS_KEEP_ORPHAN;
05199                         }
05200                         mdt_mfd_close(info, mfd);
05201                 }
05202         }
05203         info->mti_mdt = NULL;
05204         /* cleanup client slot early */
05205         /* Do not erase record for recoverable client. */
05206         if (!(exp->exp_flags & OBD_OPT_FAILOVER) || exp->exp_failed)
05207                 tgt_client_del(&env, exp);
05208         lu_env_fini(&env);
05209 
05210         RETURN(rc);
05211 }
05212 
05213 static inline void mdt_enable_slc(struct mdt_device *mdt)
05214 {
05215         if (mdt->mdt_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel == NEVER_SYNC_ON_CANCEL)
05216                 mdt->mdt_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel = BLOCKING_SYNC_ON_CANCEL;
05217 }
05218 
05219 static inline void mdt_disable_slc(struct mdt_device *mdt)
05220 {
05221         if (mdt->mdt_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel == BLOCKING_SYNC_ON_CANCEL)
05222                 mdt->mdt_lut.lut_sync_lock_cancel = NEVER_SYNC_ON_CANCEL;
05223 }
05224 
05225 static int mdt_obd_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
05226 {
05227         int rc;
05228         ENTRY;
05229 
05230         LASSERT(exp);
05231         class_export_get(exp);
05232 
05233         if ((exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) &&
05234             !(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT)) {
05235                 struct mdt_device *mdt = mdt_dev(exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
05236 
05237                 if (atomic_dec_and_test(&mdt->mdt_mds_mds_conns))
05238                         mdt_disable_slc(mdt);
05239         }
05240 
05241         rc = server_disconnect_export(exp);
05242         if (rc != 0)
05243                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "server disconnect error: rc = %d\n", rc);
05244 
05245         rc = mdt_export_cleanup(exp);
05246         nodemap_del_member(exp);
05247         class_export_put(exp);
05248         RETURN(rc);
05249 }
05250 
05251 /* mds_connect copy */
05252 static int mdt_obd_connect(const struct lu_env *env,
05253                            struct obd_export **exp, struct obd_device *obd,
05254                            struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
05255                            struct obd_connect_data *data,
05256                            void *localdata)
05257 {
05258         struct obd_export       *lexp;
05259         struct lustre_handle    conn = { 0 };
05260         struct mdt_device       *mdt;
05261         int                      rc;
05262         lnet_nid_t              *client_nid = localdata;
05263         ENTRY;
05264 
05265         LASSERT(env != NULL);
05266         if (!exp || !obd || !cluuid)
05267                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05268 
05269         mdt = mdt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
05270 
05271         if ((data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) &&
05272             !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT)) {
05273                 atomic_inc(&mdt->mdt_mds_mds_conns);
05274                 mdt_enable_slc(mdt);
05275         }
05276 
05277         /*
05278          * first, check whether the stack is ready to handle requests
05279          * XXX: probably not very appropriate method is used now
05280          *      at some point we should find a better one
05281          */
05282         if (!test_bit(MDT_FL_SYNCED, &mdt->mdt_state) && data != NULL &&
05283             !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_LIGHTWEIGHT) &&
05284             !(data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS)) {
05285                 rc = obd_get_info(env, mdt->mdt_child_exp,
05286                                   sizeof(KEY_OSP_CONNECTED),
05287                                   KEY_OSP_CONNECTED, NULL, NULL);
05288                 if (rc)
05289                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
05290                 set_bit(MDT_FL_SYNCED, &mdt->mdt_state);
05291         }
05292 
05293         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
05294         if (rc)
05295                 RETURN(rc);
05296 
05297         lexp = class_conn2export(&conn);
05298         LASSERT(lexp != NULL);
05299 
05300         rc = nodemap_add_member(*client_nid, lexp);
05301         if (rc != 0 && rc != -EEXIST)
05302                 GOTO(out, rc);
05303 
05304         rc = mdt_connect_internal(lexp, mdt, data);
05305         if (rc == 0) {
05306                 struct lsd_client_data *lcd = lexp->exp_target_data.ted_lcd;
05307 
05308                 LASSERT(lcd);
05309                 memcpy(lcd->lcd_uuid, cluuid, sizeof lcd->lcd_uuid);
05310                 rc = tgt_client_new(env, lexp);
05311                 if (rc == 0)
05312                         mdt_export_stats_init(obd, lexp, localdata);
05313         }
05314 out:
05315         if (rc != 0) {
05316                 class_disconnect(lexp);
05317                 nodemap_del_member(lexp);
05318                 *exp = NULL;
05319         } else {
05320                 *exp = lexp;
05321                 /* Because we do not want this export to be evicted by pinger,
05322                  * let's not add this export to the timed chain list. */
05323                 if (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_MDS_MDS) {
05324                         spin_lock(&lexp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
05325                         list_del_init(&lexp->exp_obd_chain_timed);
05326                         spin_unlock(&lexp->exp_obd->obd_dev_lock);
05327                 }
05328         }
05329 
05330         RETURN(rc);
05331 }
05332 
05333 static int mdt_obd_reconnect(const struct lu_env *env,
05334                              struct obd_export *exp, struct obd_device *obd,
05335                              struct obd_uuid *cluuid,
05336                              struct obd_connect_data *data,
05337                              void *localdata)
05338 {
05339         lnet_nid_t             *client_nid = localdata;
05340         int                     rc;
05341         ENTRY;
05342 
05343         if (exp == NULL || obd == NULL || cluuid == NULL)
05344                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05345 
05346         rc = nodemap_add_member(*client_nid, exp);
05347         if (rc != 0 && rc != -EEXIST)
05348                 RETURN(rc);
05349 
05350         rc = mdt_connect_internal(exp, mdt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev), data);
05351         if (rc == 0)
05352                 mdt_export_stats_init(obd, exp, localdata);
05353         else
05354                 nodemap_del_member(exp);
05355 
05356         RETURN(rc);
05357 }
05358 
05359 /* FIXME: Can we avoid using these two interfaces? */
05360 static int mdt_init_export(struct obd_export *exp)
05361 {
05362         struct mdt_export_data *med = &exp->exp_mdt_data;
05363         int                     rc;
05364         ENTRY;
05365 
05366         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&med->med_open_head);
05367         spin_lock_init(&med->med_open_lock);
05368         mutex_init(&med->med_idmap_mutex);
05369         med->med_idmap = NULL;
05370         spin_lock(&exp->exp_lock);
05371         exp->exp_connecting = 1;
05372         spin_unlock(&exp->exp_lock);
05373 
05374         /* self-export doesn't need client data and ldlm initialization */
05375         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
05376                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
05377                 RETURN(0);
05378 
05379         rc = tgt_client_alloc(exp);
05380         if (rc)
05381                 GOTO(err, rc);
05382 
05383         rc = ldlm_init_export(exp);
05384         if (rc)
05385                 GOTO(err_free, rc);
05386 
05387         RETURN(rc);
05388 
05389 err_free:
05390         tgt_client_free(exp);
05391 err:
05392         CERROR("%s: Failed to initialize export: rc = %d\n",
05393                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
05394         return rc;
05395 }
05396 
05397 static int mdt_destroy_export(struct obd_export *exp)
05398 {
05399         ENTRY;
05400 
05401         if (exp_connect_rmtclient(exp))
05402                 mdt_cleanup_idmap(&exp->exp_mdt_data);
05403 
05404         target_destroy_export(exp);
05405         /* destroy can be called from failed obd_setup, so
05406          * checking uuid is safer than obd_self_export */
05407         if (unlikely(obd_uuid_equals(&exp->exp_obd->obd_uuid,
05408                                      &exp->exp_client_uuid)))
05409                 RETURN(0);
05410 
05411         ldlm_destroy_export(exp);
05412         tgt_client_free(exp);
05413 
05414         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_outstanding_replies));
05415         LASSERT(list_empty(&exp->exp_mdt_data.med_open_head));
05416 
05417         RETURN(0);
05418 }
05419 
05420 int mdt_links_read(struct mdt_thread_info *info, struct mdt_object *mdt_obj,
05421                    struct linkea_data *ldata)
05422 {
05423         int rc;
05424 
05425         LASSERT(ldata->ld_buf->lb_buf != NULL);
05426 
05427         if (!mdt_object_exists(mdt_obj))
05428                 return -ENODATA;
05429 
05430         rc = mo_xattr_get(info->mti_env, mdt_object_child(mdt_obj),
05431                           ldata->ld_buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
05432         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
05433                 /* Buf was too small, figure out what we need. */
05434                 lu_buf_free(ldata->ld_buf);
05435                 rc = mo_xattr_get(info->mti_env, mdt_object_child(mdt_obj),
05436                                   ldata->ld_buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
05437                 if (rc < 0)
05438                         return rc;
05439                 ldata->ld_buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(ldata->ld_buf, rc);
05440                 if (ldata->ld_buf->lb_buf == NULL)
05441                         return -ENOMEM;
05442                 rc = mo_xattr_get(info->mti_env, mdt_object_child(mdt_obj),
05443                                   ldata->ld_buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK);
05444         }
05445         if (rc < 0)
05446                 return rc;
05447 
05448         return linkea_init(ldata);
05449 }
05450 
05464 static int mdt_path_current(struct mdt_thread_info *info,
05465                             struct mdt_object *obj,
05466                             struct getinfo_fid2path *fp,
05467                             struct lu_fid *root_fid)
05468 {
05469         struct mdt_device       *mdt = info->mti_mdt;
05470         struct mdt_object       *mdt_obj;
05471         struct link_ea_header   *leh;
05472         struct link_ea_entry    *lee;
05473         struct lu_name          *tmpname = &info->mti_name;
05474         struct lu_fid           *tmpfid = &info->mti_tmp_fid1;
05475         struct lu_buf           *buf = &info->mti_big_buf;
05476         char                    *ptr;
05477         int                     reclen;
05478         struct linkea_data      ldata = { NULL };
05479         int                     rc = 0;
05480         bool                    first = true;
05481         ENTRY;
05482 
05483         /* temp buffer for path element, the buffer will be finally freed
05484          * in mdt_thread_info_fini */
05485         buf = lu_buf_check_and_alloc(buf, PATH_MAX);
05486         if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
05487                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
05488 
05489         ldata.ld_buf = buf;
05490         ptr = fp->gf_u.gf_path + fp->gf_pathlen - 1;
05491         *ptr = 0;
05492         --ptr;
05493         *tmpfid = fp->gf_fid = *mdt_object_fid(obj);
05494 
05495         while (!lu_fid_eq(root_fid, &fp->gf_fid)) {
05496                 struct lu_buf           lmv_buf;
05497 
05498                 if (!lu_fid_eq(root_fid, &mdt->mdt_md_root_fid) &&
05499                     lu_fid_eq(&mdt->mdt_md_root_fid, &fp->gf_fid))
05500                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
05501 
05502                 mdt_obj = mdt_object_find(info->mti_env, mdt, tmpfid);
05503                 if (IS_ERR(mdt_obj))
05504                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(mdt_obj));
05505 
05506                 if (!mdt_object_exists(mdt_obj)) {
05507                         mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, mdt_obj);
05508                         GOTO(out, rc = -ENOENT);
05509                 }
05510 
05511                 if (mdt_object_remote(mdt_obj)) {
05512                         mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, mdt_obj);
05513                         GOTO(remote_out, rc = -EREMOTE);
05514                 }
05515 
05516                 rc = mdt_links_read(info, mdt_obj, &ldata);
05517                 if (rc != 0) {
05518                         mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, mdt_obj);
05519                         GOTO(out, rc);
05520                 }
05521 
05522                 leh = buf->lb_buf;
05523                 lee = (struct link_ea_entry *)(leh + 1); /* link #0 */
05524                 linkea_entry_unpack(lee, &reclen, tmpname, tmpfid);
05525                 /* If set, use link #linkno for path lookup, otherwise use
05526                    link #0.  Only do this for the final path element. */
05527                 if (first && fp->gf_linkno < leh->leh_reccount) {
05528                         int count;
05529                         for (count = 0; count < fp->gf_linkno; count++) {
05530                                 lee = (struct link_ea_entry *)
05531                                      ((char *)lee + reclen);
05532                                 linkea_entry_unpack(lee, &reclen, tmpname,
05533                                                     tmpfid);
05534                         }
05535                         if (fp->gf_linkno < leh->leh_reccount - 1)
05536                                 /* indicate to user there are more links */
05537                                 fp->gf_linkno++;
05538                 }
05539 
05540                 lmv_buf.lb_buf = info->mti_xattr_buf;
05541                 lmv_buf.lb_len = sizeof(info->mti_xattr_buf);
05542                 /* Check if it is slave stripes */
05543                 rc = mo_xattr_get(info->mti_env, mdt_object_child(mdt_obj),
05544                                   &lmv_buf, XATTR_NAME_LMV);
05545                 mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, mdt_obj);
05546                 if (rc > 0) {
05547                         union lmv_mds_md *lmm = lmv_buf.lb_buf;
05548 
05549                         /* For slave stripes, get its master */
05550                         if (le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmv_magic) == LMV_MAGIC_STRIPE) {
05551                                 fp->gf_fid = *tmpfid;
05552                                 continue;
05553                         }
05554                 } else if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENODATA) {
05555                         GOTO(out, rc);
05556                 }
05557 
05558                 rc = 0;
05559 
05560                 /* Pack the name in the end of the buffer */
05561                 ptr -= tmpname->ln_namelen;
05562                 if (ptr - 1 <= fp->gf_u.gf_path)
05563                         GOTO(out, rc = -EOVERFLOW);
05564                 strncpy(ptr, tmpname->ln_name, tmpname->ln_namelen);
05565                 *(--ptr) = '/';
05566 
05567                 /* keep the last resolved fid to the client, so the
05568                  * client will build the left path on another MDT for
05569                  * remote object */
05570                 fp->gf_fid = *tmpfid;
05571 
05572                 first = false;
05573         }
05574 
05575 remote_out:
05576         ptr++; /* skip leading / */
05577         memmove(fp->gf_u.gf_path, ptr,
05578                 fp->gf_u.gf_path + fp->gf_pathlen - ptr);
05579 
05580 out:
05581         RETURN(rc);
05582 }
05583 
05599 static int mdt_path(struct mdt_thread_info *info, struct mdt_object *obj,
05600                     struct getinfo_fid2path *fp, struct lu_fid *root_fid)
05601 {
05602         struct mdt_device       *mdt = info->mti_mdt;
05603         int                     tries = 3;
05604         int                     rc = -EAGAIN;
05605         ENTRY;
05606 
05607         if (fp->gf_pathlen < 3)
05608                 RETURN(-EOVERFLOW);
05609 
05610         if (root_fid == NULL)
05611                 root_fid = &mdt->mdt_md_root_fid;
05612 
05613         if (lu_fid_eq(root_fid, mdt_object_fid(obj))) {
05614                 fp->gf_u.gf_path[0] = '\0';
05615                 RETURN(0);
05616         }
05617 
05618         /* Retry multiple times in case file is being moved */
05619         while (tries-- && rc == -EAGAIN)
05620                 rc = mdt_path_current(info, obj, fp, root_fid);
05621 
05622         RETURN(rc);
05623 }
05624 
05641 static int mdt_fid2path(struct mdt_thread_info *info,
05642                         struct lu_fid *root_fid,
05643                         struct getinfo_fid2path *fp)
05644 {
05645         struct mdt_device *mdt = info->mti_mdt;
05646         struct mdt_object *obj;
05647         int    rc;
05648         ENTRY;
05649 
05650         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "path get "DFID" from "LPU64" #%d\n",
05651                 PFID(&fp->gf_fid), fp->gf_recno, fp->gf_linkno);
05652 
05653         if (!fid_is_sane(&fp->gf_fid))
05654                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05655 
05656         if (!fid_is_namespace_visible(&fp->gf_fid)) {
05657                 CWARN("%s: "DFID" is invalid, sequence should be "
05658                       ">= "LPX64"\n", mdt_obd_name(mdt),
05659                       PFID(&fp->gf_fid), (__u64)FID_SEQ_NORMAL);
05660                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05661         }
05662 
05663         obj = mdt_object_find(info->mti_env, mdt, &fp->gf_fid);
05664         if (IS_ERR(obj)) {
05665                 rc = PTR_ERR(obj);
05666                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "cannot find "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05667                        PFID(&fp->gf_fid), rc);
05668                 RETURN(rc);
05669         }
05670 
05671         if (mdt_object_remote(obj))
05672                 rc = -EREMOTE;
05673         else if (!mdt_object_exists(obj))
05674                 rc = -ENOENT;
05675         else
05676                 rc = 0;
05677 
05678         if (rc < 0) {
05679                 mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, obj);
05680                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "nonlocal object "DFID": rc = %d\n",
05681                        PFID(&fp->gf_fid), rc);
05682                 RETURN(rc);
05683         }
05684 
05685         rc = mdt_path(info, obj, fp, root_fid);
05686 
05687         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "fid "DFID", path %s recno "LPX64" linkno %u\n",
05688                PFID(&fp->gf_fid), fp->gf_u.gf_path,
05689                fp->gf_recno, fp->gf_linkno);
05690 
05691         mdt_object_put(info->mti_env, obj);
05692 
05693         RETURN(rc);
05694 }
05695 
05696 static int mdt_rpc_fid2path(struct mdt_thread_info *info, void *key, int keylen,
05697                             void *val, int vallen)
05698 {
05699         struct getinfo_fid2path *fpout, *fpin;
05700         struct lu_fid *root_fid = NULL;
05701         int rc = 0;
05702 
05703         fpin = key + cfs_size_round(sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH));
05704         fpout = val;
05705 
05706         if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(info->mti_pill->rc_req))
05707                 lustre_swab_fid2path(fpin);
05708 
05709         memcpy(fpout, fpin, sizeof(*fpin));
05710         if (fpout->gf_pathlen != vallen - sizeof(*fpin))
05711                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05712 
05713         if (keylen >= cfs_size_round(sizeof(KEY_FID2PATH)) + sizeof(*fpin) +
05714                       sizeof(struct lu_fid)) {
05715                 /* client sent its root FID, which is normally fileset FID */
05716                 root_fid = fpin->gf_u.gf_root_fid;
05717                 if (ptlrpc_req_need_swab(info->mti_pill->rc_req))
05718                         lustre_swab_lu_fid(root_fid);
05719 
05720                 if (root_fid != NULL && !fid_is_sane(root_fid))
05721                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
05722         }
05723 
05724         rc = mdt_fid2path(info, root_fid, fpout);
05725         RETURN(rc);
05726 }
05727 
05728 int mdt_get_info(struct tgt_session_info *tsi)
05729 {
05730         char    *key;
05731         int      keylen;
05732         __u32   *vallen;
05733         void    *valout;
05734         int      rc;
05735 
05736         ENTRY;
05737 
05738         key = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY);
05739         if (key == NULL) {
05740                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "No GETINFO key\n");
05741                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
05742         }
05743         keylen = req_capsule_get_size(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_KEY,
05744                                       RCL_CLIENT);
05745 
05746         vallen = req_capsule_client_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VALLEN);
05747         if (vallen == NULL) {
05748                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "%s: cannot get RMF_GETINFO_VALLEN buffer\n",
05749                                 tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
05750                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
05751         }
05752 
05753         req_capsule_set_size(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VAL, RCL_SERVER,
05754                              *vallen);
05755         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(tsi->tsi_pill);
05756         if (rc)
05757                 RETURN(err_serious(rc));
05758 
05759         valout = req_capsule_server_get(tsi->tsi_pill, &RMF_GETINFO_VAL);
05760         if (valout == NULL) {
05761                 CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "%s: cannot get get-info RPC out buffer\n",
05762                                 tgt_name(tsi->tsi_tgt));
05763                 RETURN(err_serious(-EFAULT));
05764         }
05765 
05766         if (KEY_IS(KEY_FID2PATH)) {
05767                 struct mdt_thread_info  *info = tsi2mdt_info(tsi);
05768 
05769                 rc = mdt_rpc_fid2path(info, key, keylen, valout, *vallen);
05770                 mdt_thread_info_fini(info);
05771         } else {
05772                 rc = -EINVAL;
05773         }
05774         RETURN(rc);
05775 }
05776 
05777 /* Pass the ioc down */
05778 static int mdt_ioc_child(struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *mdt,
05779                          unsigned int cmd, int len, void *data)
05780 {
05781         struct lu_context ioctl_session;
05782         struct md_device *next = mdt->mdt_child;
05783         int rc;
05784         ENTRY;
05785 
05786         rc = lu_context_init(&ioctl_session, LCT_SERVER_SESSION);
05787         if (rc)
05788                 RETURN(rc);
05789         ioctl_session.lc_thread = (struct ptlrpc_thread *)current;
05790         lu_context_enter(&ioctl_session);
05791         env->le_ses = &ioctl_session;
05792 
05793         LASSERT(next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol);
05794         rc = next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(env, next, cmd, len, data);
05795 
05796         lu_context_exit(&ioctl_session);
05797         lu_context_fini(&ioctl_session);
05798         RETURN(rc);
05799 }
05800 
05801 static int mdt_ioc_version_get(struct mdt_thread_info *mti, void *karg)
05802 {
05803         struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
05804         struct lu_fid *fid;
05805         __u64 version;
05806         struct mdt_object *obj;
05807         struct mdt_lock_handle  *lh;
05808         int rc;
05809         ENTRY;
05810 
05811         if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL || data->ioc_inllen1 != sizeof(*fid) ||
05812             data->ioc_inlbuf2 == NULL || data->ioc_inllen2 != sizeof(version))
05813                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05814 
05815         fid = (struct lu_fid *)data->ioc_inlbuf1;
05816 
05817         if (!fid_is_sane(fid))
05818                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
05819 
05820         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "getting version for "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
05821 
05822         lh = &mti->mti_lh[MDT_LH_PARENT];
05823         mdt_lock_reg_init(lh, LCK_CR);
05824 
05825         obj = mdt_object_find_lock(mti, fid, lh, MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE);
05826         if (IS_ERR(obj))
05827                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
05828 
05829         if (mdt_object_remote(obj)) {
05830                 rc = -EREMOTE;
05835                 CERROR("nonlocal object "DFID"\n", PFID(fid));
05836         } else if (!mdt_object_exists(obj)) {
05837                 *(__u64 *)data->ioc_inlbuf2 = ENOENT_VERSION;
05838                 rc = -ENOENT;
05839         } else {
05840                 version = dt_version_get(mti->mti_env, mdt_obj2dt(obj));
05841                *(__u64 *)data->ioc_inlbuf2 = version;
05842                 rc = 0;
05843         }
05844         mdt_object_unlock_put(mti, obj, lh, 1);
05845         RETURN(rc);
05846 }
05847 
05848 /* ioctls on obd dev */
05849 static int mdt_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
05850                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
05851 {
05852         struct lu_env      env;
05853         struct obd_device *obd = exp->exp_obd;
05854         struct mdt_device *mdt = mdt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev);
05855         struct dt_device  *dt = mdt->mdt_bottom;
05856         int rc;
05857 
05858         ENTRY;
05859         CDEBUG(D_IOCTL, "handling ioctl cmd %#x\n", cmd);
05860         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_MD_THREAD);
05861         if (rc)
05862                 RETURN(rc);
05863 
05864         switch (cmd) {
05865         case OBD_IOC_SYNC:
05866                 rc = mdt_device_sync(&env, mdt);
05867                 break;
05868         case OBD_IOC_SET_READONLY:
05869                 rc = dt->dd_ops->dt_ro(&env, dt);
05870                 break;
05871         case OBD_IOC_ABORT_RECOVERY:
05872                 CERROR("%s: Aborting recovery for device\n", mdt_obd_name(mdt));
05873                 obd->obd_abort_recovery = 1;
05874                 target_stop_recovery_thread(obd);
05875                 rc = 0;
05876                 break;
05877         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_REG:
05878         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_DEREG:
05879         case OBD_IOC_CHANGELOG_CLEAR:
05880                 rc = mdt_ioc_child(&env, mdt, cmd, len, karg);
05881                 break;
05882         case OBD_IOC_START_LFSCK: {
05883                 struct md_device *next = mdt->mdt_child;
05884                 struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
05885                 struct lfsck_start_param lsp;
05886 
05887                 if (unlikely(data == NULL)) {
05888                         rc = -EINVAL;
05889                         break;
05890                 }
05891 
05892                 lsp.lsp_start = (struct lfsck_start *)(data->ioc_inlbuf1);
05893                 lsp.lsp_index_valid = 0;
05894                 rc = next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(&env, next, cmd, 0, &lsp);
05895                 break;
05896         }
05897         case OBD_IOC_STOP_LFSCK: {
05898                 struct md_device        *next = mdt->mdt_child;
05899                 struct obd_ioctl_data   *data = karg;
05900                 struct lfsck_stop        stop;
05901 
05902                 stop.ls_status = LS_STOPPED;
05903                 /* Old lfsck utils may pass NULL @stop. */
05904                 if (data->ioc_inlbuf1 == NULL)
05905                         stop.ls_flags = 0;
05906                 else
05907                         stop.ls_flags =
05908                         ((struct lfsck_stop *)(data->ioc_inlbuf1))->ls_flags;
05909 
05910                 rc = next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(&env, next, cmd, 0, &stop);
05911                 break;
05912         }
05913         case OBD_IOC_QUERY_LFSCK: {
05914                 struct md_device        *next = mdt->mdt_child;
05915                 struct obd_ioctl_data   *data = karg;
05916 
05917                 rc = next->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(&env, next, cmd, 0,
05918                                                  data->ioc_inlbuf1);
05919                 break;
05920         }
05921         case OBD_IOC_GET_OBJ_VERSION: {
05922                 struct mdt_thread_info *mti;
05923                 mti = lu_context_key_get(&env.le_ctx, &mdt_thread_key);
05924                 memset(mti, 0, sizeof *mti);
05925                 mti->mti_env = &env;
05926                 mti->mti_mdt = mdt;
05927                 mti->mti_exp = exp;
05928 
05929                 rc = mdt_ioc_version_get(mti, karg);
05930                 break;
05931         }
05932         case OBD_IOC_CATLOGLIST: {
05933                 struct mdt_thread_info *mti;
05934 
05935                 mti = lu_context_key_get(&env.le_ctx, &mdt_thread_key);
05936                 lu_local_obj_fid(&mti->mti_tmp_fid1, LLOG_CATALOGS_OID);
05937                 rc = llog_catalog_list(&env, mdt->mdt_bottom, 0, karg,
05938                                        &mti->mti_tmp_fid1);
05939                 break;
05940          }
05941         default:
05942                 rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
05943                 CERROR("%s: Not supported cmd = %d, rc = %d\n",
05944                         mdt_obd_name(mdt), cmd, rc);
05945         }
05946 
05947         lu_env_fini(&env);
05948         RETURN(rc);
05949 }
05950 
05951 static int mdt_postrecov(const struct lu_env *env, struct mdt_device *mdt)
05952 {
05953         struct lu_device *ld = md2lu_dev(mdt->mdt_child);
05954         int rc;
05955         ENTRY;
05956 
05957         if (!mdt->mdt_skip_lfsck) {
05958                 struct lfsck_start_param lsp;
05959 
05960                 lsp.lsp_start = NULL;
05961                 lsp.lsp_index_valid = 0;
05962                 rc = mdt->mdt_child->md_ops->mdo_iocontrol(env, mdt->mdt_child,
05963                                                            OBD_IOC_START_LFSCK,
05964                                                            0, &lsp);
05965                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -EALREADY)
05966                         CWARN("%s: auto trigger paused LFSCK failed: rc = %d\n",
05967                               mdt_obd_name(mdt), rc);
05968         }
05969 
05970         rc = ld->ld_ops->ldo_recovery_complete(env, ld);
05971         RETURN(rc);
05972 }
05973 
05974 static int mdt_obd_postrecov(struct obd_device *obd)
05975 {
05976         struct lu_env env;
05977         int rc;
05978 
05979         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_MD_THREAD);
05980         if (rc)
05981                 RETURN(rc);
05982         rc = mdt_postrecov(&env, mdt_dev(obd->obd_lu_dev));
05983         lu_env_fini(&env);
05984         return rc;
05985 }
05986 
05987 static struct obd_ops mdt_obd_device_ops = {
05988         .o_owner          = THIS_MODULE,
05989         .o_set_info_async = mdt_obd_set_info_async,
05990         .o_connect        = mdt_obd_connect,
05991         .o_reconnect      = mdt_obd_reconnect,
05992         .o_disconnect     = mdt_obd_disconnect,
05993         .o_init_export    = mdt_init_export,
05994         .o_destroy_export = mdt_destroy_export,
05995         .o_iocontrol      = mdt_iocontrol,
05996         .o_postrecov      = mdt_obd_postrecov,
05997 };

05999 static struct lu_device* mdt_device_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
06000                                          struct lu_device *d)
06001 {
06002         struct mdt_device *m = mdt_dev(d);
06003         ENTRY;
06004 
06005         mdt_fini(env, m);
06006         RETURN(NULL);
06007 }
06008 
06009 static struct lu_device *mdt_device_free(const struct lu_env *env,
06010                                          struct lu_device *d)
06011 {
06012         struct mdt_device *m = mdt_dev(d);
06013         ENTRY;
06014 
06015         lu_device_fini(&m->mdt_lu_dev);
06016         OBD_FREE_PTR(m);
06017 
06018         RETURN(NULL);
06019 }
06020 
06021 static struct lu_device *mdt_device_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
06022                                           struct lu_device_type *t,
06023                                           struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
06024 {
06025         struct lu_device  *l;
06026         struct mdt_device *m;
06027 
06028         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(m);
06029         if (m != NULL) {
06030                 int rc;
06031 
06032                 l = &m->mdt_lu_dev;
06033                 rc = mdt_init0(env, m, t, cfg);
06034                 if (rc != 0) {
06035                         mdt_device_free(env, l);
06036                         l = ERR_PTR(rc);
06037                         return l;
06038                 }
06039         } else
06040                 l = ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
06041         return l;
06042 }
06043 
06044 /* context key constructor/destructor: mdt_key_init, mdt_key_fini */
06045 LU_KEY_INIT(mdt, struct mdt_thread_info);
06046 
06047 static void mdt_key_fini(const struct lu_context *ctx,
06048                          struct lu_context_key *key, void* data)
06049 {
06050         struct mdt_thread_info *info = data;
06051 
06052         if (info->mti_big_lmm) {
06053                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(info->mti_big_lmm, info->mti_big_lmmsize);
06054                 info->mti_big_lmm = NULL;
06055                 info->mti_big_lmmsize = 0;
06056         }
06057         OBD_FREE_PTR(info);
06058 }

06061 LU_CONTEXT_KEY_DEFINE(mdt, LCT_MD_THREAD);

06064 {
06065         return lu_ucred(info->mti_env);

06070         return lu_ucred_check(info->mti_env);

06081 void mdt_enable_cos(struct mdt_device *mdt, int val)
06082 {
06083         struct lu_env env;
06084         int rc;
06085 
06086         mdt->mdt_opts.mo_cos = !!val;
06087         rc = lu_env_init(&env, LCT_LOCAL);
06088         if (unlikely(rc != 0)) {
06089                 CWARN("%s: lu_env initialization failed, cannot "
06090                       "sync: rc = %d\n", mdt_obd_name(mdt), rc);
06091                 return;
06092         }
06093         mdt_device_sync(&env, mdt);
06094         lu_env_fini(&env);
06095 }
06096 
06104 int mdt_cos_is_enabled(struct mdt_device *mdt)
06105 {
06106         return mdt->mdt_opts.mo_cos != 0;
06107 }

06110         .ldto_device_alloc = mdt_device_alloc,
06111         .ldto_device_free  = mdt_device_free,
06112         .ldto_device_fini  = mdt_device_fini
06113 };

06115 static struct lu_device_type mdt_device_type = {
06116         .ldt_tags     = LU_DEVICE_MD,
06117         .ldt_name     = LUSTRE_MDT_NAME,
06118         .ldt_ops      = &mdt_device_type_ops,
06119         .ldt_ctx_tags = LCT_MD_THREAD
06120 };
06121 
06122 static int __init mdt_init(void)
06123 {
06124         int rc;
06125 
06126         CLASSERT(sizeof("0x0123456789ABCDEF:0x01234567:0x01234567") ==
06127                  FID_NOBRACE_LEN + 1);
06128         CLASSERT(sizeof("[0x0123456789ABCDEF:0x01234567:0x01234567]") ==
06129                  FID_LEN + 1);
06130         rc = lu_kmem_init(mdt_caches);
06131         if (rc)
06132                 return rc;
06133 
06134         rc = mds_mod_init();
06135         if (rc)
06136                 GOTO(lu_fini, rc);
06137 
06138         rc = class_register_type(&mdt_obd_device_ops, NULL, true, NULL,
06139                                  LUSTRE_MDT_NAME, &mdt_device_type);
06140         if (rc)
06141                 GOTO(mds_fini, rc);
06142 lu_fini:
06143         if (rc)
06144                 lu_kmem_fini(mdt_caches);
06145 mds_fini:
06146         if (rc)
06147                 mds_mod_exit();
06148         return rc;
06149 }
06150 
06151 static void __exit mdt_exit(void)
06152 {
06153         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_MDT_NAME);
06154         mds_mod_exit();
06155         lu_kmem_fini(mdt_caches);
06156 }
